author: Peerzada Ashiq
text:
Army jawans cordon off the Bijbehara area in Anantnag district of south Kashmir after the grenade attack on Saturday.— PHOTO: NISSAR AHMAD

Two soldiers and a civilian were injured in a militant attack in south Kashmir’s Bijbehara area, 45 km away from Srinagar, on Saturday.

According to the police spokesman, a grenade was hurled close to a police station. Several bursts of fire followed the blast near the police station located on the Srinagar-Jammu National Highway, said the spokesman. The injured were shifted to a hospital.

Militant outfit Hizbul Mujahideen claimed responsibility for the attack. “The grenade was aimed at the Army personnel who left many either injured or dead,” Hizb’s self-styled operational spokesperson Burhanuddin told Srinagar-based news agency CNS. “The boys [militants] have been directed to intensify attacks on Indian security establishment,” he said.

Soldier’s body found

The Army’s rescue team on Saturday located the body of Rifleman Sunil Rai who went missing after an avalanche hit a patrol party in Ladakh’s Tirtuk area on Friday morning.

Another soldier Lance Havildar Bhawan Tamang too died in the avalanche.

Tamang is survived by his wife, a six-year-old daughter and his parents, whereas Rai is survived by his parents and two younger brothers.
title: Three injured in grenade attack
